text: Anna Smashnova-Pistolesi was the defending champion, but was forced to retire in her second round match against Sandra Kleinová due to a hamstring injury. Alicia Molik won the title by defeating Tatiana Perebiynis 6–1, 6–1 in the final. ==Seeds== ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ===Bottom Half=== ==References== ==External links== * Official results archive (ITF) * Official results archive (WTA) Singles Nordea Nordic Light Open
title: 2004 Nordea Nordic Light Open – Singles
